com.ibm.watson.dsm.platform

Interface IApplicationDescriptor

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ApplicationDescriptor

    public interface IApplicationDescriptor
extends java.io.Serializable
    Defines the information needed about an application instance. An application instance is one application with a common name space which is shared among the instances. An application must have a name which can be shared by other other members of the distributed application. The name can be thought of as a name space that groups the distributed members of the application. The application must also have a unique identifier which identifies it within the application name space. All applications that use the same name space will be able to communicate with each other and share data. Application instances may optionally be assigned a hierarchical classification, which can then be used for application instance selection when issuing queries.
    Author:
    dawood

    • Method Summary

      Methods

      java.lang.String getApplicationNamespace()
      Get the namespace/application name of this application instance..

    • Method Detail

      • getApplicationNamespace

        java.lang.String getApplicationNamespace()
        Get the namespace/application name of this application instance.. The application name is a name that a set of cooperating applications may share. These cooperating applications are generally sharing tuples with the namespace defined by this application name.
        Returns:
        never null.

      • getClassification

        HierarchicalName getClassification()
        Get the optional classification of this application instance.
        Returns:
        never null.

      • getInstanceID

        java.lang.String getInstanceID()
        The key value with with the application should be registered in an ITupleApplicationRegistry. This key must be unique within all application instances with the same name and is the value expected in the first column of Transport tuples. It is used to look up in URI scheme used by the application to receive tuples.
        Returns:
        never null.
